topic: Stopping criteria for multi-agent research loops

claims: A diminishing-returns score should measure novelty exhaustion and semantic stability, not correctness.
A composite stop rule (low novelty + high stability for k rounds) is more robust than a single metric.
open_questions: How do we detect false convergence (agreement on the wrong thing)?
next_actions: Define transcript and round-output schemas so novelty can be computed as set difference over claims.
outputs.summary: Round 1: define the goal and pick a composite stopping rule; start threat-modeling false convergence.
